revised_title: A Discussion on Aeronautical Aerodynamics and Air Pollution in UK Towns
tldr: This article discusses air pollution in towns in the United Kingdom and the role of aerodynamicists, architects, and town planners in reducing urban pollution. It examines the changes in smoke and sulfur dioxide emissions and concentrations in different regions of the UK and suggests ways to improve air quality, such as using architectural aerodynamics in town planning and implementing district heating systems.
